item.title: "Virat Kohli Wanted Conflict And Confrontation": Ex-RCB Teammate Blasts India Stalwart - NDTV Sports
item.description:
"Virat Kohli Wanted Conflict And Confrontation": Ex-RCB Teammate Blasts India Stalwart

Publication Date: January 25, 2025

Source: NDTV Sports

Virat Kohli's recent tour in Australia ended on a controversial note, raising questions about his mindset during the matches. Kohli faced criticism from former teammates for his on-field behavior.

  • Kohli started the series strong with a century but finished with poor performance.
  • He was fined 20% of his match fees after a clash with Australia's Sam Konstas.
  • Simon Katich expressed concerns over Kohli's reputation due to multiple incidents during the tour.
  • Aaron Finch noted that Kohli seemed to be seeking conflict to spark his performance.
  • Kohli struggled with scoring, amassing only 190 runs across nine innings.
“There’s no doubt he has been a modern great of the game ... but I think he’s tarnished his reputation somewhat on this tour.” - Simon Katich

Overall, Kohli's performance raised more questions than answers, indicating a need for reflection moving forward.

item.title: Sunil Gavaskar Predicts India's Next Captain After Rohit Sharma: 'He Leads From The Front' - News18
item.description:
Sunil Gavaskar Predicts India's Next Captain After Rohit Sharma: 'He Leads From The Front'

Date: January 09, 2025

Source: News

Legendary former cricketer Sunil Gavaskar believes Jasprit Bumrah is the frontrunner to become India’s next captain, potentially taking over from Rohit Sharma soon. Gavaskar praised Bumrah’s leadership qualities and his ability to support his teammates without applying pressure.

  • Bumrah has led India in two Tests during the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.
  • Gavaskar noted Bumrah’s visible leadership and guidance on the field.
  • Bumrah's leadership is under consideration due to Rohit Sharma’s inconsistent performance and personal absence.
  • The BCCI will hold a review meeting to discuss the future of leadership in the team.
  • There are concerns about Bumrah's workload as he is now the only all-format player for India.
“He leads from the front. He has got a very good air about him. The air of a leader,” - Sunil Gavaskar

The potential change in captaincy highlights the evolving leadership dynamics within the Indian cricket team, particularly in light of recent performances.

item.title: India Squad For Champions Trophy And England ODIs Live Updates: No Place For Suryakumar Yadav? BCCI Sent Big Message - NDTV Sports
item.description:
India Squad For Champions Trophy And England ODIs Live Updates

Date: January 9, 2025 | Source: NDTV Sports Desk

The announcement of the Indian squad for the 2025 Champions Trophy and ODIs against England has stirred speculation regarding player selections, notably concerning Suryakumar Yadav.

  • Aakash Chopra predicts Yadav will not be selected for the Champions Trophy.
  • Jasprit Bumrah's fitness is under scrutiny, potentially sidelining him for several months.
  • Yashasvi Jaiswal is a prospective inclusion in the squad.
  • Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli may see this as their last ICC event.
  • The ODI series against England starts from February 6, leading up to the Champions Trophy.
“Suryakumar Yadav isn't there but Shreyas Iyer is. Since the start of the World Cup, he has scored 620 runs in 15 innings, with two centuries, at a strike rate of 112 and an average of 52.” – Aakash Chopra

As the countdown begins to the tournaments, the fate of several key players is uncertain, making this an exciting yet nerve-wracking moment for Indian cricket fans.

item.title: Champions Trophy 2025: India to play warm-up game in Dubai, PCB assures venue availability in time - CricTracker
item.description:
Champions Trophy 2025: India to Play Warm-Up Game in Dubai

Publication Date: Not specified, Source: Hindustan Times

India have declined to travel to Pakistan for the Champions Trophy 2025 and will therefore play all their matches in Dubai. The PCB has assured that the stadiums will be ready for practice games.

  • Eight teams will compete for the trophy, with India playing in Dubai.
  • Concerns about stadium availability in Pakistan have been addressed.
  • PCB has assured that venues will be ready by January 25.
  • The Champions Trophy kicks off on February 19, with the opening match between Pakistan and New Zealand.
"The renovation work is on track and the stadiums will be ready before the deadline," stated PCB.

PCB's assurance regarding the venue readiness aims to ensure smooth hosting of the tournament.

item.title: Shafali in the 'scheme of things' for Ireland ODI series, says Mandhana - Cricbuzz
item.description:
Shafali in the 'scheme of things' for Ireland ODI series, says Mandhana

Published on: Thu, Jan 9, 2025, 12:37 PM by Cricbuzz

Smriti Mandhana, captain of the Indian women's team, indicates that Shafali Verma may reclaim her place in the squad for the ODI series against Ireland, starting January 10, after impressive domestic performances.

  • Shafali was dropped from the squad due to poor scores in previous matches.
  • Pratika Rawal impressed as her replacement with notable scores.
  • Shafali has shown strong form in domestic games, scoring impressive runs.
  • Madhana acknowledges Pratika's contributions but emphasizes Shafali's potential impact.
  • Mandhana expresses confidence in the team's fielding capabilities and adaptability to conditions.
  • This series is significant as India has not frequently played against Ireland.
"I'm really happy that she went back and got those runs," Mandhana on Shafali.

In conclusion, Mandhana focuses on maintaining a positive mindset and looks forward to facing Ireland, highlighting the excitement of playing against a less familiar opponent.

item.title: Bik Baye ": When India Star Took Dig At BCCI's Effort To Suppress Rift News Between Gautam Gambhir And... - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Samosa Mein Bik Gaye: When India Star Took Dig At BCCI's Effort To Suppress Rift News Between Gautam Gambhir And...

Publication Date: January 25, 2025 | Source: NDTV

The Indian cricket team recently faced rumors of a dressing room rift during the Border Gavaskar Trophy series against Australia. Coach Gautam Gambhir and captain Rohit Sharma aimed to quell the speculations, asserting that their focus should not be on external noise.

  • The dressing room witnessed talk of a potential captain candidate amidst the series.
  • A historical reference was made to a 2012 incident involving a 'chai samosa party' to calm tensions within the team.
  • Gautam Gambhir emphasized that the rumors were just reports and not reflective of the truth.
  • He affirmed that discussions should remain within the team context and stressed the importance of performance in retaining one's position.
"Heard you guys won't be covering the rift anymore. Samosa mein bik gaye (sold out for a samosa)?!"

Gambhir concluded that the integrity of the team is of utmost importance, and honest conversations are key to addressing any underlying issues.

item.title: Jasprit Bumrah's 150-plus overs in Australia: Not a first for the pace spearhead - The Times of India
item.description:
Jasprit Bumrah's 150-plus overs in Australia: Not a first for the pace spearhead

Date: NEW DELHI

Source: Times of India

Jasprit Bumrah's recent performance during the Border-Gavaskar Trophy has sparked discussions surrounding his workload management as he bowled an impressive 151.2 overs.

  • Bumrah was the leading wicket-taker with 32 wickets in the series.
  • Concerns arose when he experienced a back spasm after bowling 10 overs in the Test series.
  • Despite his high overs bowled, other bowlers like Siraj and Australian pacers bowled more overs.
  • This is not the first time Bumrah has exceeded 150 overs in a series.
“The 31-year-old pacer had bowled 157.1 overs during the 2018-19 tour of Australia.”

The article highlights the need for proper workload management in cricket to maintain player fitness and performance levels.

item.title: 'People have dragged Virat Kohli's wife, too': Sidhu furious at 'blame games' in unfiltered rant, calls for 'respect' - Hindustan Times
item.description:
People have dragged Virat Kohli's wife, too': Sidhu furious at 'blame games' in unfiltered rant, calls for 'respect'

Date: Jan 09, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

In a passionate defense, former cricketer Navjot Singh Sidhu criticized the harsh treatment towards Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma amidst their recent poor performance in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, urging fans to show respect and patience.

  • Kohli scored only 190 runs in five Tests, while Rohit missed the last Test due to form issues.
  • Sidhu referenced the historical allowances given to past players for their slumps.
  • He emphasized the importance of supporting Kohli and Sharma as they prepare for upcoming ODI matches.
  • Criticism of Kohli has crossed personal boundaries, which Sidhu condemned.
“It's not the first time when Kohli faced criticism, people even drag his wife. It's wrong, we must respect our heroes. Keep patience.”

Sidhu believes in their potential comeback and calls for a more supportive fan base during tough times.

item.title: 'Virat Kohli should have been banned for what he did to Sam Konstas' - The Times of India
item.description:
Virat Kohli should have been banned for what he did to Sam Konstas

Publication Date: Not provided Source: Times of India

Former England pacer Steve Harmison condemns Virat Kohli’s behavior during a recent match against debutant Sam Konstas, suggesting that Kohli should have received a ban for his actions.

  • Kohli received a demerit point and a 20% fine for physical contact with Konstas during the Boxing-Day Test.
  • The incident escalated with Kohli and Konstas exchanging intense glares before umpires intervened.
  • Harmison warns Konstas about the challenges he will face in the upcoming Ashes series.
  • Harmison emphasized the need for Konstas to focus on his defensive technique instead of mimicking aggressive players like David Warner.
“What happened with Kohli there – Kohli was bang out of order. Virat Kohli should have been banned for what he did.” - Steve Harmison

The incident has raised questions about player conduct in high-pressure situations and the implications for both Kohli and Konstas as they navigate their respective careers in cricket.

item.title: ‘Gautam Gambhir is a hypocrite’: Manoj Tiwary blasts India head coach after BGT failure - The Indian Express
item.description:
‘Gautam Gambhir is a hypocrite’: Manoj Tiwary blasts India head coach after BGT failure

Date: January 9, 2025
Source: Indian Express

Former India batter Manoj Tiwary criticized India coach Gautam Gambhir after a disappointing Border Gavaskar Trophy, labeling him a ‘hypocrite’ for not practicing what he preaches.

  • Tiwary accused Gambhir of favoritism and questioned why certain players from Mumbai received preferential treatment.
  • He noted that Gambhir's captaincy during the Kolkata Knight Riders' 2012 IPL win was a collective team effort, not just due to Gambhir’s leadership.
  • Gambhir is under scrutiny after India’s BGT loss to Australia, marking a failure after a decade.
“Gautam Gambhir doesn’t do what he says... But who took the credit? There is an environment and PR that allows him to take all the credit.” - Manoj Tiwary

Gambhir faces mounting pressure as India not only lost the BGT but also suffered a series of defeats across formats leading up to this event.

item.title: Shreyas Iyer: The X-factor Team India needs for ICC Champions Trophy - The Times of India
item.description:
Shreyas Iyer: The X-factor Team India Needs for ICC Champions Trophy

Date: Not specified Source: Times of India

With the ICC Champions Trophy approaching, Shreyas Iyer is emerging as a key player for Team India, known for his performance under pressure and strong portrayal in domestic cricket.

  • Iyer is recognized for his elegant stroke-play and middle-order stability.
  • He has shown excellent performance in the domestic circuit, including a standout in the 2023 ODI World Cup.
  • His recent performances include significant runs in various tournaments, boosting his chances to secure a spot in the Champions Trophy squad.
  • Despite some setbacks in his career, he has rebounded admirably and is now considered a vital team asset.
“Ignoring Iyer for the Champions Trophy 2025 squad could mean missing out on a game-changing asset.”

Iyer’s ability to anchor innings and excel under pressure makes him a potential X-factor for the Indian team in upcoming crucial matches.

item.title: Viral Video: 41 Days From Champions Trophy, State Of Pakistan Stadiums Amid Row - NDTV Sports
item.description:
State of Pakistan Stadiums 41 Days Before Champions Trophy

Publication Date: January 8, 2025 | Source: NDTV

As the ICC Champions Trophy approaches, concerns rise over Pakistan's ability to host due to ongoing stadium construction. A viral video highlights progress at Gaddafi Stadium, showcasing extensive work with over 250 workers on-site.

  • Main construction ongoing at Gaddafi Stadium, Lahore with visible progress.
  • Reports indicate stadiums in Lahore, Karachi, and Rawalpindi are still under construction with a January 25 deadline.
  • Renovations include the installation of new LED lights, digital screens, and seating upgrades.
  • Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) has relocated upcoming tri-series matches to UAE for better preparedness.
“The weather is not ideal for construction… They just can't be random rooms/enclosures for an ICC event.” - Source regarding stadium conditions.

Amid uncertainties, PCB is making efforts to ensure the stadiums are ready in time for the tournament, but significant challenges remain.

item.title: India's Squad For Champions Trophy: Rishabh Pant Dropped From 15-Member Side By Ex-Stars - NDTV Sports
item.description:
India's Squad For Champions Trophy: Rishabh Pant Dropped From 15-Member Side By Ex-Stars

Publication Date: January 25, 2025

Source: NDTV

The selection for India's ICC Champions Trophy 2025 has sparked debate, particularly regarding the wicket-keeper position, with Rishabh Pant being left out of the squad by former cricketers Sanjay Manjrekar and Sanjay Bangar.

  • Three candidates were considered for the wicket-keeper role: KL Rahul, Rishabh Pant, and Sanju Samson.
  • Former selectors expressed doubts about Pant's recent form, citing his long absence from ODI cricket.
  • Bangar emphasized KL Rahul's reliability as the first-choice keeper.
  • Manjrekar advocated for Sanju Samson over Pant as the backup keeper.
“Pant was away from cricket for a long time... KL Rahul should be your first-choice keeper,” - Sanjay Bangar.

This decision is contentious amidst discussions of team dynamics and past performance, especially since Pant's return in 2024 was marked by a subpar ODI performance.

item.title: 4wd,4,4,4,4,4,4! N Jagadeesan smashes six consecutive fours in one over in Vijay Hazare Trophy match - Wa - The Times of India
item.description:
N Jagadeesan Smashes Six Consecutive Fours in One Over During Vijay Hazare Trophy Match

Publication Date: [Insert Date Here]

Source: [Insert Source Here]

In a stunning display of batting prowess, N Jagadeesan achieved the remarkable feat of hitting six consecutive fours in a single over during a Vijay Hazare Trophy match. This record-breaking moment has captured the attention of cricket fans and enthusiasts alike.

  • N Jagadeesan is playing in the Vijay Hazare Trophy.
  • He hit six consecutive fours in one over, showcasing extraordinary skill.
  • This achievement is likely to create a buzz within the cricketing community.
“It was an incredible feeling to hit six fours in an over, something I had only dreamed of before.” - N Jagadeesan

This exceptional performance not only highlights N Jagadeesan's talent but also adds excitement to the ongoing tournament, promising more thrilling matches ahead.

item.title: Shots fired at Sports Ministry after Manu Bhaker Khel Ratna controversy, accused of ‘favouritism’ by WFI chief - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Shots fired at Sports Ministry after Manu Bhaker Khel Ratna controversy, accused of ‘favouritism’ by WFI chief

Date: Jan 09, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

The sports ministry confirmed that Manu Bhaker will receive the Major Dhyan Chand Khel Ratna Award after controversy surrounding her initial omission from the nominations. WFI chief Sanjay Singh criticized the nomination process for favouritism.

  • Manu Bhaker added to Khel Ratna list amid confusion.
  • WFI President Sanjay Singh accused the ministry of favouritism.
  • Bhaker accepted a possible lapse on her part for the oversight in nominations.
  • Bhaker is a two-time Olympic medalist and a prominent figure in Indian shooting.
  • Other Khel Ratna recipients include D Gukesh, Haranpreet Singh, and Praveen Kumar.
“Officials sit and try to include their favourite people in the list of Khel Ratna.” - Sanjay Singh, WFI President

The controversy has sparked discussions about fairness in the award nomination process, highlighting the need for transparency in recognizing outstanding athletes.
